wikipedia_page.main: Lynne Duval (née Robinson, born 21 June 1969) is an English former middle-distance runner. She finished fourth in the 800 metres final at the 1986 World Junior Championships and went on to win the 1500 metres title at the 1993 Universiade.

link_mentions.page: 1986 World Junior Championships in Athletics – Women's 800 metres
Athletics at the 1993 Summer Universiade – Women's 1500 metres
Athletics at the 1991 Summer Universiade – Women's 1500 metres

response: Born in Nottingham, Hall ran 53.08 secs for 400 metres as a 16-year-old at a Junior international in July 1984. She won an English Schools 200 m title in 1984, and a AAA Junior Indoor Championships 400 m title in 1985, before winning a bronze medal in the 4 × 400 metres relay at the 1985 European Junior Championships in Cottbus with teammates Georgina Honley, Lynne Robinson and Dawn Flockhart.European Junior Championships. World Junior Athletics History. Retrieved 3 April 2018. In other junior internationals, she took a sprint sweep from 100 m to 400 m in Australia, won a 100 m in Cyprus and won a 200 m/400 m double at the Cosford Indoor Games.Our Story. Natural Notts. Retrieved on 8 April 2018.
